Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Giles E
Reviews.Content: Everyone, from the life guard at the pool, to the cleaners, to the restaurant staff to reception, was extremely helpful and welcoming. Nothing too much trouble. Excellent price, outstanding service. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Away from city center but very nice spot by car”
Reviews.Author: drix08
Reviews.Content: These hotel matched our expectations.We knew it was a litle bit away from city center but with some good deals that worked for us like free wireless conection at all hotel areas and rooms ,free parking with plenty space,swimming pool and padle court.Actually, it 's very easy to get to city center by car, about 10 minutes on a very acessible road.The hotel itself is nice and clean.The rooms and bathrooms are big enough.No complains at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with an easily accessible location (by car)”
Reviews.Author: AnnikadeBruijne
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a nice stay at this hotel. It was very pleasant and the staff were helpful. It is located about a 10 minute drive out of the cbd so be prepared for that, however if you have a car this is no problem and we were advised there was a bus at the front door running regularly to take you to the city if need be. Free parking was included, and we didn't opt to have breakfast included so can't comment, but the restaurant looked very nice and was catering for a wedding one of the evenings we stayed (including loud noise from the music!) so it is likely quite a nice restaurant. I was surprised there wasn't a fitness centre on site or nearby, as it is a four star rated hotel and we were also disappointed the swimming pool wasn't open despite consistent 30 degree plus weather daily for weeks now and it was one of the reasons we booked here in the first place. Upon check in we were advised the pool wasn't opening for another 2-3 weeks. The room was very clean, the bed extremely comfortable. Noise was fine (apart from the wedding night!) and all very private and secluded despite being a large hotel. The staff were very friendly, including helping us to make a reverse charges call overseas which was lovely. Very helpful in giving directions and a map etc. Internet connection was free in the rooms, and the wifi access had great reception unlike some of our other stays. Good stay, and if you are preferring to stay a little out of town I would recommend this hotel - otherwise you might be better to stay in the cbd.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but unhappy stay because of noisy room neighbours”
Reviews.Author: FabJF
Reviews.Content: We chose this 4-star-hotel because the room was offered for a good price and because it offered parking for free. The welcome, the room itself as well as the breakfast buffet were perfectly ok. The view (skyline of Madrid in the distance) in fact was quite nice and we had internet connection for free in the room. So it could have been a really nice stay. The problem was that we had asked for a silent room but unfortunately our room neighbours (a group of young tennis players which were wild awake at night!) had other plans and made it almost impossible to sleep. At least not till about 3 am. So I was kind of frustrated the next morning because I needed to work... But as I said - without this incident it could have been a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great base outside town”
Reviews.Author: mattarm33
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as I had a car and did not want to pay for expensive car parks in Madeid(that's if you can find one). It is only a 12 minute drive to the centre, or you can park in the suburbs and get the metro. The receptionist was a pleasant man, who spoke good English. The room was clean and comfy. Though I don't like the pillows, but all hotels in Spain seem to use the same ones. I like mine nice and soft, not hard. Breakfast was good, with a good selection, and the woman in the breakfast reception was also very pleasant. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Mire84
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Madrid in February 2010 on business reasons. I got the to the hotel after a fairly long flight, and even longer taxi drive (it's almost 30 mins drive from the main Madrid airport by highway). When I reached the hotel I was told that my room wasn't reasdy yet (it was somewhere around 13.00h), but after 30-45 mins I finally got the chance to get to my room. I specifically asked the lobby to get me a room where the internet connection would work thru cable, not WiFi - even called in advance the hotel to make sure they can offer this service (internet is free of charge). 1st thing I do in the room, check the net connection, and not to my surprise it wasn't working, which led me to calling the reception. After explaining that I know how to connect to the internet, they informed that the technical guy would check the issues only after lunch somewhere after 16.00. Indeed the guy tried his best to fix it in the roo m (while I was downstairs for a late lunch and specifically asked the reception to call me when he gets to my room). whatever the case, the connection wasn't working and so I had to take my computer and find a room where it would work. Not very nice to move all your stuff from one room to the other, but efforts must be done to work late in the evening ;-). All in all, room was clean (and cleaned daily) & spacious; stuff in the bathroom always refreshed; furniture in good condition; english speacking channels on tv avaialble; breakfast same thing each morning but plenty of choices no worries (even good coffee :)) and service is nice. Not a wide choice for late lunch, but you can do wiht a good cesar's salade. they also have a pool if you happen to drop by during summer. The hotel actually has 3 buildings, and in the main one you have the restaurant and reception (esspecially if you are sleepy in the morning and outside is pretty cold); it's located in a quite location, outside the city but not far from it. Good to know: there is a bus stop just in front of the hotel and it will take you 20 mins to get to one of the subway station (almost 30mins to get to the city centre). there are some shops not far from the hotel (not sure where cause I saw them from the bus) and some restaurants. The taxi drive airport-hotel is 35-40e. Hotel has parking.

Reviews.Title: “Best for the summer”
Reviews.Author: capdail2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Eurostars Zarzuela in November. I think the hotel is nice, but I think it would have been even better in summer, as the swimming pool is outdoors and can not be used in November. With a recent promotion, the price was quite attractive (if pre-paid) and then it became a much more attractive proposal compared to another large chain hotel within the same neighbourhood. However, the hotel had far too many noisy guests who did not mind screaming in the corridors and outside (by the porch, which is right in front of some rooms) after midnight.Since the hotel has two separate buildings, the receptionists did not have any idea that all this noise was going on in the hotel. If you go here for business, and you are used to other business hotels in Spain providing some amenities such as a toothbrush, toothpaste and shaving razor, you may be surprised not to find them in your room at Eurostars Zarzuela. However, the receptionist can give them to you upon request. The in-room TVs are located at an inconvenient angle if you watch them from the bed. The remote control key you need to press to start watching TV is the "program up" or "down" key, not the usual "stand-by" key or the channel numbers. If you get here by taxi, be sure to have a map to indicate the hotel's location. If the taxi does not have a GPS, it can be hard to find a taxi driver who knows its location. I spent 20 minutes in a taxi looking for it after midnight when coming from the city center. I found that the gates of the hotel had been closed by then. Upon ringing the bell at the pedestrian entry point I did not get an answer from reception, and had to walk in through the car gates after ringing that one's bell, which the receptionist was able to hear. Free wifi works very well and fast in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Smart and friendly hotel with touch of luxury at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: DavidL70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife while atteding a sporting event nearby. Having looked at previous reviews I was a little apprehensive about the location, need for a cash deposit, lack of nearby local restaurants and the quality of service.But, because I needed a hire car and more centrally located hotels were charging up to 25 euros a night for parking (parking at Zarzuela Park is free) I gave it a punt. We were not disappointed. All the staff were very helpful and friendly and no deposit was required (we had prepaid with Lastminute). The room was large and clean and had a reasonably sized fridge.The breakfast was very good and we ate in the hotel restaurant one evening too. While this was not cheap, it was not exorbitantly expensive. The food was very good and was beatifully presented and the waiting staff were very pleasant and good humoured (and remained so when we saw them back on duty serving the breakfast the next morning).There is a also very pleasant outdoor pool. Because we had a car we had no trouble getting to a metro station where we could get into central Madrid cheaply and effortlessly. However, we could see that there were frequent buses to Monclua station stopping directly outside the hotel. If you have a car and you would rather not pay more for your parking than you did for the car hire, this hotel is an excellent choice

Reviews.Title: “Bit out of the way but great otherwise”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: New hotel in suburban ( and seemingly new) residential area. Quite green and airy despite the construction and roads etc. Nothing local in the way of shops,bars etc, so everything is a (frequent) 10-15 minute bus ride away to the nearest Metro station in the student area. Good place to stay if arriving in Madrid by/with car. Out of holiday season when I was there, so,apart from one office function "invasion", the place was quiet and too hard to guage whether there would be any atmosphere in the restaurant in the holiday season. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “warning to all travellers”
Reviews.Author: nemotre
Reviews.Content: This hotel is VERY far from the city centre. To get to Moncloa (which is not even where the attactions are) you need at least 20 minutes on a bus that stops in front of the hotel every 20/25 min. The hotel is located in a very quiet and brand new residential area, there is basically nothing there. So if you are not looking for an accomodation in Aravaca, do not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “TOP HOTEL :)”
Reviews.Author: MAndersen4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 days in July! Very nice hotel. clean rooms, quite and a nice pool. Only minus is its location. There IS nothing to do in walking distance from the hotel. No shops, no nothing. It takes about 30 min to get to the city center with public transport, but it stops quite early in the night. But the hotel was a nice experience, would recommend it to anyone. Just remember to rent a car :)

Reviews.Title: “Ignorant, rude and total rip off”
Reviews.Author: clareadams68
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the pool, which we can't fault. Be warned when you check in, they will ask for a deposit, even if you have paid for the holiday. We only had €250 euros in total for entire stay, but still had to pay €150 deposit, which would only be returned on check-out. We had to catch bus and metro every morning to get food for the day, as we could no longer afford to eat in restaurant. There was no mention of a deposit when booking. We found the staff quite rude and they only seemed to help the spanish people staying there. On the good side, the rooms were clean, but I would not class them as 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: interlude19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night and was disappointed with it. It is quite difficult to find and even with our Sat Nav had to drive up and down the road before we could find it. It is quite a way outside Madrid but the bus stops right outside the hotel and takes you to the nearest railway station and you can get into the centre of Madrid very quickly. There was plenty of parking at the hotel and first impressions is that it looks like Colditz! Very cold and stark buidings. It is quite modern inside with very little character. The rooms were quite large and clean, with a good bathroom. We were very disappointed to find that there was no room service after 9pm at night which was not good for a 4 star hotel. We found the breakfast awful. Unless you come down as soon as it opens, they do not replenish the dishes therefore by the time we sat down, there was very little left. The staff were quite unfriendly and overall would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and quite, but car essential”
Reviews.Author: FresnoSurfer
Reviews.Content: If you are in Madrid with a car, this hotel is one of your better choices. It is located in an affluent, quite residential neighborhood about 15 minutes north of the center, with easy access to the freeway. The rooms are reasonably sized (for European standards), clean, modern, and air-conditioned. The hotel is located on a low hill, offering nice views of the city while enjoying the well groomed lawns around the refreshing, good size pool. When going down to the city, expect to pay between 5 and 20 Euros for parking. This, however, is offset by the fact that parking at the hotel is free – unlike parking at the city center hotel which is outrageously expensive (if it is offered in the first place). Keep in mind that finding parking in the center of Madrid is much easier and cheaper than in many other European capitals. This hotel is not a good choice if you do not have a car. Public transportation is non-existent, and there is nothing but private homes within walking distance. There is a restaurant in the hotel. I did not try it, but it seems a bit overpriced. Why bother when you are only minutes away from all the restaurants the city has to offer?

Reviews.Title: “Great base for seeing Madrid and also sitting around a nice pool (as long as you have a car)”
Reviews.Author: royalstu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we wanted to see Madrid and also chill around a nice pool. Our 9 year old daughter loved the hotel pool which is quite large and kept very clean and tidy. A life guard is on duty whilst the pool is open from 11am to 2.30pm and then again from 3.30pm until 9pm. This meant we could explore the Madrid region during the day, and still come back for a nice dip before summer. As we keep kosher, we had no need for the hotel restaurant. But it seemed quite busy in the evenings. The hotel is in a residential neighbourhood, but whilst you are there, you would never know. The grounds are small but pretty, and the area is very quiet and peaceful. There is a bus stop outside the hotel, but we had a hire car. You can park for free around the Moncloa Metro station during the week, and around the Teleferico at the weekend. It is only a few stops into Madrid from there. Although we decided not to take the car into the city, our general experiences with Spanish car parks were very favourable. We Londoners did not find anything to do with transport and parking expensive (it makes London look outrageously expensive and untidy). Book hotel, car and flight early and you can get a real bargain. Madrid is a beautiful and interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “Lost in Spain”
Reviews.Author: geosu
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because it was on the outskirts of Madrid with parking, near to the airport. Good job we had sat-nav in our hire car as we'd never have found it otherwise. And after a night out the only way the taxi found it was also using sat-nav! The hotel is situated in a residential area with no facilities nearby. As for the accomodation, the rooms are lovely, modern, clean and comfortable. The breakfast is excellent. The dinner was good if a little expensive. One bugbear was that we came back early from Madrid on a saturday evening to eat, and found that the restaurant was closed. With no restaurants or bars nearby we had to go without any food or head back into Madrid. As the taxi we'd got earlier in the day had got 7 euros already on the clock before we even got in it, we decided to call it a night and just go to bed. (We could have got a bus, but it stops running at 11.30). We weren't warned of this closure beforehand which was a little amiss of the hotel. I wouldnt stay at this hotel again, purely beacuse there is nothing nearby and it is just too far out of town. Get somewhere within walking distance of at least a metro station. Such a shame because the accomodation was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel but that"s about it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on the Sunday night, hotel looked ok,we asked if there was a bar which we assumed had some food bearing in mind this was about 9pm. Well there was a bar but no food! Tried room service- this was not available so after leaving the Uk at 3pm we have peanuts and drinks from the mini bar for dinner.We thought never mind breakfast will soon be here and planned to have a swim or perhaps go to the advertised gym.Breakfast was good,waiters lovely.We thought we'd ask about the swimming pool after all this was the reason we picked this 4 star hotel which we knew was 17km from the city.Surprise surprise swimming pool was closed.I want to know why it did not state in the website that the swimming pool was closed and the gym was not in use neither.This would have been a great hotel to chill out if everything that it advertised was true.I certainly will not stay there in a hurry!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel but that is about it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend break in Madrid with lastminute which placed us in Zarzuela Park Hotel. The Hotel as the other reviews have said is nice and clean but consider the hotel has only been open for 1 year so it should be. We arrived late September 05 in Madrid to a nice 29 degrees Celsius and could not wait to take a swim in the Hotels advertised swimming pool. We asked if we could have the key to the pool only to be told that it was closed as we had arrived "out of season". They informed us that the pool closes mid September. I was very annoyed by this as neither lastminute or the hotels website (eurostarshotels) said anything about the pool closing. We picked this hotel as we wanted to relax by the pool in the very hot weather that Madrid has this time of the year. The hotel has a very nice garden and outdoor area around the pool which would have been nice to use but the Hotel has no furniture to sit on at all so you have to sit on a wall which becomes very uncomfortable after a few minutes. They have I think 4 tables with 4 chairs for each table outside the cafe/bar area which after about midday is in the shade. The bar was advertised in the Hotel Guide in room as being open on Saturday from 2pm until midnight. I fancied a beer as I was on holiday so waited from midday until 2pm for the bar to open. This never happened so I found a member of staff and asked him if I could buy a beer from the bar as it was supposed to be opening at 2pm. The answer I got was "not today" I queried the hotel guide with him and he looked at me and said "not today, we will open at 8pm and shut at 11:30pm. This is not good enough when the hotel advertises differently in it's guide. The hotel is in the middle of a residential area so the nearest place to buy anything at all is Moncloa whish is 10 minutes bus ride away. Also as the other reviews have said, Taxi's do not know where it is and if they do they don't always want to take you. The bus (161) runs from Moncloa to right outside the hotel but stops running at 11:30pm. Madrid only starts to get busy at night around 11pm so the bus finishes a bit early. My girlfriend and I stood on the side of the road in Moncloa hailing taxis for each of the 3 nights we where there and each time at least 4 taxis refused to take us before one did and we even made sure we had a detailed map of how to get to the hotel by car from Moncloa. Junction 9 off the A6. Some taxis just said no, some said not out of the city. The Hotel has 2 tennis courts which are nice but they are undersized. There is also absolutely nothing to do for children whatsoever. This didn't affect me but just something to note The Hotel is clean and quiet but if you want to go for a break in Madrid and to see the capital then I would advise staying in the centre. If you want to relax at the hotel it is very quiet so you could do this but bring your own chair. By the way breakfast there is a buffet style breakfast and costs 10 Euros. Get a better breakfast and cheaper in Madrid. The hotel is obviously understaffed, they weren't rude but they weren't that helpful either.

Reviews.Title: “great and peacefull”
Reviews.Author: George B
Reviews.Content: The down side was taxis didn't know where it was. The hotel was beautifull with the rooms airy and clean. The food was excellent and very reasonably priced.The staff were all very helpfull at all times. There was a bus stop outside the hotel which was a bonus as the hotel is in a quiet part of the city suburbs.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurostars Zarzuela Park
HotelInfo.Address: Dario Aparicio, 32, 28023 Madrid, Spain
